info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 8:12PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT EASTERN COLUMBIANA...BEAVER... NORTHWESTERN WASHINGTON...NORTHWESTERN ALLEGHENY AND HANCOCK COUNTIES THROUGH 845 PM EDT... At 812 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles west of Imperial, or 9 miles east of Weirton, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Pittsburgh, Ross Township, McCandless Township, Cranberry, Moon Township, Weirton, Franklin Park, East Liverpool, Aliquippa, Monaca, Shaler Township, Hampton Township, Robinson Township, Cecil-Bishop, Economy, Bellevue, Carnegie, Kennedy Township, Ambridge, and Wexford. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 29 and 40. Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 58 and 78. Parkway North between mile markers 6 and 13. Interstate 376 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 34 and 64. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
